title: Exporting multiple files with same file name under different directories to zip file fails
description: Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch WSWB and create two projects. 2. Under each project, create a new file with the same name (such as 'foo.txt'). 3. From the main menu, select File -> Export and select 'Zip File' to export. 4. In the 'Export' dialog window, select both projects created earlier, give the zip file a name (such as 'test.zip') and begin the export to zip file. Results: An error message box pops up, indicating that there were problems encountered during the export. The error message also points to the file with the same name in project 2 as the problem.
OB: When attempting to export multiple files with the same name, but located under different directories, to a zip file using WSWB, an error message box pops up during the export process. The error message specifically refers to the file with the same name in project 2 as the problem.
EB: The export process should succeed without any errors, allowing all the files with same names from different directories to be included in the resulting zip file.
SR:
1. Launch WSWB and create two projects.
2. Under each project, create a new file with the same name (such as 'foo.txt').
3. From the main menu, select File -> Export and choose 'Zip File' from the options.
4. In the 'Export' dialog window, select both projects that were created earlier.
5. Give the zip file a specific name (such as 'test.zip') and start the export process.
6. Verify that the export process completes successfully without any error messages.
